intro: Scabiosa sylvatica, commonly known as woodland scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodland areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces slender, erect stems and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Scabiosa sylvatica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
